intro: Fordiophyton jinpingense, commonly known as the Jinping lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white and pink petals. The plant typically grows in high-altitude forested areas, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its botanical features include a slender stem and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
